ptpbaseMIB.name: ptpbaseMIB

revisions.description: Initial version of this MIB module, published as RFC 8173.

ptpbaseMIB.contactinfo: WG Email: tictoc@ietf.org Vinay Shankarkumar Cisco Systems Email: vinays@cisco.com Laurent Montini Cisco Systems Email: lmontini@cisco.com Tim Frost Calnex Solutions Ltd. Email: tim.frost@calnexsol.com Greg Dowd Microsemi Inc. Email: greg.dowd@microsemi.com
ptpbaseMIB.description: The MIB module for PTP version 2 Copyright (c) 2017 IETF Trust and the persons identified as authors of the code. All rights reserved. Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, is permitted pursuant to, and subject to the license terms contained in, the Simplified BSD License set forth in Section 4.c of the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions Relating to IETF Documents (http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info). Overview of PTP version 2 (IEEE Std. 1588-2008) [IEEE-1588-2008] defines a protocol enabling precise synchronization of clocks in measurement and control systems implemented with packet-based networks, the Precision Time Protocol version 2 (PTPv2). This MIB module does not address PTPv1, the earlier version defined in IEEE Std. 1588-2002. The protocol is applicable to network elements communicating using IP. The protocol enables heterogeneous systems that include clocks of various inherent precision, resolution, and stability to synchronize to a grandmaster clock. The protocol supports system-wide synchronization accuracy in the sub-microsecond range with minimal network and local clock computing resources. [IEEE-1588-2008] uses UDP/IP or Ethernet and can be adapted to other mappings. It includes formal mechanisms for message extensions, higher sampling rates, correction for asymmetry, a clock type to reduce error accumulation in large topologies, and specifications on how to incorporate the resulting additional data into the synchronization protocol. [IEEE-1588-2008] also defines conformance and management capability. MIB description This MIB module supports the Precision Time Protocol version 2 (PTPv2, hereafter designated as PTP) features of network element system devices, when using the default PTP profile described in [IEEE-1588-2008] when running over the IP network layer. It is envisioned that this MIB module will complement other managed objects to be defined to monitor and measure the performance of the PTP devices and telecom clocks supporting specific PTP profiles. Some other PTP profiles have their own MIB modules defined as part of the profile, and this MIB module is not intended to replace those MIB modules. Technical terms used in this module are defined in [IEEE-1588-2008]. The MIB module refers to sections of [IEEE-1588-2008]. Abbreviations: E2E End-to-End EUI Extended Unique Identifier GPS Global Positioning System IANA Internet Assigned Numbers Authority IP Internet Protocol NTP Network Time Protocol (see [RFC5905]) P2P Peer-to-Peer PTP Precision Time Protocol TAI International Atomic Time UDP User Datagram Protocol UTC Coordinated Universal Time References: [IEEE-1588-2008] IEEE Standard for A Precision Clock Synchronization Protocol for Networked Measurement and Control Systems, IEEE Std. 1588-2008, July 2008. The below table specifies the object formats of the various textual conventions used. Data type mapping Textual Convention SYNTAX ------------------- --------------------- ------------------ 5.3.2 TimeInterval PtpClockTimeInterval OCTET STRING(SIZE(1..255)) 5.3.3 Timestamp PtpClockTimestamp OCTET STRING(SIZE(6)) 5.3.4 ClockIdentity PtpClockIdentity OCTET STRING(SIZE(8)) 5.3.5 PortIdentity PtpClockPortNumber INTEGER(1..65535) 5.3.7 ClockQuality PtpClockQualityClassType

PtpClockDomainType.name: PtpClockDomainType
PtpClockDomainType.description: The Domain is identified by an integer, the domainNumber, in the range of 0 to 255. An integer value that is used to assign each PTP device to a particular domain.

PtpClockIdentity.name: PtpClockIdentity
PtpClockIdentity.description: The clock identity is an 8-octet array and will be presented in the form of a character array. Network byte order is assumed. The value of the PtpClockIdentity should be taken from the IEEE EUI-64 individual assigned numbers as indicated in Section 7.5.2.2.2 of [IEEE-1588-2008]. It can also be a non-EUI-64 address as defined in Section 7.5.2.2.3 of [IEEE-1588-2008]. The clock identifier can be constructed from existing EUI-48 assignments.

PtpClockInstanceType.name: PtpClockInstanceType
PtpClockInstanceType.description: The instance of the clock of a given clock type in a given domain.

PtpClockIntervalBase2.name: PtpClockIntervalBase2
PtpClockIntervalBase2.description: The interval included in message types Announce, Sync, Delay_Req, and Pdelay_Req as indicated in Section 7.7.2.1 of [IEEE-1588-2008].

PtpClockMechanismType.name: PtpClockMechanismType
PtpClockMechanismType.description: The clock type based on whether end-to-end or peer-to-peer mechanisms are used. The mechanism used to calculate the Mean Path Delay as indicated in Table 9 of [IEEE-1588-2008].
PtpClockMechanismType.reference: Sections 8.2.5.4.4 ('portDS.delayMechanism'), 6.6.4 ('Measuring link propagation delay in clocks supporting peer-to-peer path correction'), and 7.4.2 ('communication Path asymmetry') of [IEEE-1588-2008].

PtpClockPortNumber.name: PtpClockPortNumber
PtpClockPortNumber.description: An index identifying a specific PTP port on a PTP node.

PtpClockPortState.name: PtpClockPortState
PtpClockPortState.description: This is the value of the current state of the protocol engine associated with this port.

PtpClockPortTransportTypeAddress.name: PtpClockPortTransportTypeAddress
PtpClockPortTransportTypeAddress.description: The clock port transport protocol address used for this communication between the clock nodes. This is a string corresponding to the address type as specified by the transport type used. The transport types can be defined elsewhere, in addition to the ones defined in this document. This can be an address of type IP version 4, IP version 6, Ethernet, DeviceNET, ControlNET, or IEC61158. The OCTET STRING representation of the OID of ptpbaseWellKnownTransportTypes will be used in the values contained in the OCTET STRING.
PtpClockPortTransportTypeAddress.reference: Annex D (IPv4), Annex E (IPv6), Annex F (Ethernet), Annex G (DeviceNET), Annex H (ControlNET), and Annex I (IEC61158) of [IEEE-1588-2008]

PtpClockProfileType.name: PtpClockProfileType
PtpClockProfileType.description: Clock Profile used. A profile is the set of allowed PTP features applicable to a device.

PtpClockQualityAccuracyType.name: PtpClockQualityAccuracyType
PtpClockQualityAccuracyType.description: The ClockQuality as specified in Section 5.3.7, Section 7.6.2.5, and Table 6 of [IEEE-1588-2008]. The following values are not represented in the enumerated values. 0x01-0x1F Reserved 0x32-0x7F Reserved It is important to note that Section 7.1.1 of RFC 2578 allows for gaps and for enumerated values to start at zero when indicated by the protocol.
PtpClockQualityAccuracyType.reference: Section 5.3.7 ('ClockQuality'), Section 7.6.2.5 ('clockAccuracy'), and Table 6 ('clockAccuracy enumeration') of [IEEE-1588-2008]

PtpClockQualityClassType.name: PtpClockQualityClassType
PtpClockQualityClassType.description: The ClockQuality as specified in Section 5.3.7, Section 7.6.2.4, and Table 5 of [IEEE-1588-2008].
PtpClockQualityClassType.reference: Section 5.3.7 ('ClockQuality'), Section 7.6.2.4 ('clockClass'), and Table 5 ('clockClass specifications') of [IEEE-1588-2008].

PtpClockRoleType.name: PtpClockRoleType
PtpClockRoleType.description: The Clock Role. The protocol generates a master-slave relationship among the clocks in the system. Clock Role Value ------------------------- Master clock 1 Slave clock 2

PtpClockStateType.name: PtpClockStateType
PtpClockStateType.description: The clock state returned by a PTP engine. Clock State Value ------------------------ Freerun state 1 Holdover state 2 Acquiring state 3 Freq_locked state 4 Phase_aligned state 5

PtpClockTimeInterval.name: PtpClockTimeInterval
PtpClockTimeInterval.description: This textual convention corresponds to the TimeInterval structure indicated in Section 5.3.2 of [IEEE-1588-2008]. It will be presented in the form of a character array. Network byte order is assumed.

PtpClockTimeSourceType.name: PtpClockTimeSourceType
PtpClockTimeSourceType.description: The ClockQuality as specified in Sections 5.3.7, Section 7.6.2.6, and Table 7 of [IEEE-1588-2008]. The following values are not represented in the enumerated values. 0xF0-0xFE For use by alternate PTP profiles 0xFF Reserved It is important to note that Section 7.1.1 of RFC 2578 allows for gaps and for enumerated values to start at zero when indicated by the protocol.
PtpClockTimeSourceType.reference: Section 5.3.7 ('ClockQuality'), Section 7.6.2.6 ('timeSource'), and Table 7 ('timeSource enumeration') of [IEEE-1588-2008].

PtpClockTxModeType.name: PtpClockTxModeType
PtpClockTxModeType.description: Transmission mode. Unicast: Using unicast communication channel. Multicast: Using Multicast communication channel. multicast-mix: Using multicast-unicast communication channel

PtpClockType.name: PtpClockType
PtpClockType.description: The clock types as defined in the MIB module description.

ptpbaseSystemTable.name: ptpbaseSystemTable
ptpbaseSystemTable.description: Table of count information about the PTP system for all domains.

ptpbaseSystemEntry.name: ptpbaseSystemEntry
ptpbaseSystemEntry.description: A table entry that contains count information about a single domain. New row entries are added when the PTP clock for this domain is configured, while the unconfiguration of the PTP clock removes them.

ptpDomainIndex.name: ptpDomainIndex
ptpDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices. The Clock Domain is a logical group of clocks and devices that synchronize with each other using the PTP protocol. 0 Default domain 1 Alternate domain 1 2 Alternate domain 2 3 Alternate domain 3 4 - 127 User-defined domains 128 - 255 Reserved

ptpInstanceIndex.name: ptpInstanceIndex
ptpInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this domain.

ptpDomainClockPortsTotal.name: ptpDomainClockPortsTotal
ptpDomainClockPortsTotal.description: This object specifies the total number of clock ports configured within a domain in the system.

ptpbaseSystemDomainTable.name: ptpbaseSystemDomainTable
ptpbaseSystemDomainTable.description: Table of information about the PTP system for all clock modes -- ordinary, boundary, or transparent.

ptpbaseSystemDomainEntry.name: ptpbaseSystemDomainEntry
ptpbaseSystemDomainEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single clock mode for the PTP system. A row entry gets added when PTP clocks are configured on the node.

ptpbaseSystemDomainClockTypeIndex.name: ptpbaseSystemDomainClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseSystemDomainClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseSystemDomainTotals.name: ptpbaseSystemDomainTotals
ptpbaseSystemDomainTotals.description: This object specifies the total number of PTP domains for this particular clock type configured in this node.

ptpbaseSystemProfile.name: ptpbaseSystemProfile
ptpbaseSystemProfile.description: This object specifies the PTP profile implemented on the system.

ptpbaseClockCurrentDSTable.name: ptpbaseClockCurrentDSTable
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSTable.description: Table of information about the PTP clock currentDS for all domains.

ptpbaseClockCurrentDSEntry.name: ptpbaseClockCurrentDSEntry
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSEntry.reference: Section 8.2.2 ('currentDS data set member specifications') of [IEEE-1588-2008]
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single PTP clock currentDS for a domain.

ptpbaseClockCurrentDSDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockCurrentDSDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockCurrentDSClockTypeIndex.name: ptpbaseClockCurrentDSClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseClockCurrentDSInstanceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockCurrentDSInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockCurrentDSStepsRemoved.name: ptpbaseClockCurrentDSStepsRemoved
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSStepsRemoved.description: The current clock dataset stepsRemoved value. This object specifies the distance measured by the number of boundary clocks between the local clock and the foreign master as indicated in the stepsRemoved field of Announce messages.

ptpbaseClockCurrentDSOffsetFromMaster.name: ptpbaseClockCurrentDSOffsetFromMaster
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSOffsetFromMaster.description: This object specifies the current clock dataset ClockOffset value. The value of the computation of the offset in time between a slave and a master clock.

ptpbaseClockCurrentDSMeanPathDelay.name: ptpbaseClockCurrentDSMeanPathDelay
ptpbaseClockCurrentDSMeanPathDelay.description: This object specifies the current clock dataset MeanPathDelay value. The mean path delay between a pair of ports as measured by the delay request-response mechanism.

ptpbaseClockParentDSTable.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSTable
ptpbaseClockParentDSTable.description: Table of information about the PTP clock parentDS for all domains.

ptpbaseClockParentDSEntry.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSEntry
ptpbaseClockParentDSEntry.reference: Section 8.2.3 ('parentDS data set member specifications') of [IEEE-1588-2008]
ptpbaseClockParentDSEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single PTP clock parentDS for a domain.

ptpbaseClockParentDSDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockParentDSDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockParentDSClockTypeIndex.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseClockParentDSClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseClockParentDSInstanceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockParentDSInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockParentDSParentPortIdentity.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSParentPortIdentity
ptpbaseClockParentDSParentPortIdentity.description: This object specifies the value of portIdentity of the port on the master that issues the Sync messages used in synchronizing this clock.

ptpbaseClockParentDSParentStats.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSParentStats
ptpbaseClockParentDSParentStats.description: This object specifies the parentDS ParentStats value. This value indicates whether the values of ParentDSOffset and ParentDSClockPhChRate have been measured and are valid. A TRUE value shall indicate valid data.

ptpbaseClockParentDSOffset.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSOffset
ptpbaseClockParentDSOffset.description: This object specifies the parentDS ParentOffsetScaledLogVariance value. This value is the variance of the parent clock's phase as measured by the local clock.

ptpbaseClockParentDSClockPhChRate.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSClockPhChRate
ptpbaseClockParentDSClockPhChRate.description: This object specifies the clock's parentDS ParentClockPhaseChangeRate value. This value is an estimate of the parent clock's phase change rate as measured by the slave clock.

ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockIdentity.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockIdentity
ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockIdentity.description: This object specifies the parentDS grandmaster clock identity.

ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockPriority1.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockPriority1
ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockPriority1.description: This object specifies the parentDS grandmaster clock priority1.

ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockPriority2.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockPriority2
ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockPriority2.description: This object specifies the parentDS grandmaster clock priority2.

ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityClass.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityClass
ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityClass.description: This object specifies the parentDS grandmaster clock quality class.

ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityAccura.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityAccuracy
ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityAccura.description: This object specifies the parentDS grandmaster clock quality accuracy.

ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityOffset.name: ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityOffset
ptpbaseClockParentDSGMClockQualityOffset.description: This object specifies the parentDS grandmaster clock quality offset.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSTable.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSTable
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSTable.description: Table of information about the PTP clock defaultDS for all domains.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSEntry.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSEntry
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single PTP clock defaultDS for a domain.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSClockTypeIndex.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSInstanceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSTwoStepFlag.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSTwoStepFlag
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSTwoStepFlag.description: This object specifies whether the two-step process is used.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSClockIdentity.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSClockIdentity
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSClockIdentity.description: This object specifies the defaultDS clockIdentity member.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSPriority1.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSPriority1
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSPriority1.description: This object specifies the defaultDS priority1 member.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSPriority2.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSPriority2
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSPriority2.description: This object specifies the defaultDS priority2 member.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSSlaveOnly.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSSlaveOnly
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSSlaveOnly.description: This object specifies whether the SlaveOnly flag is set.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityClass.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityClass
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityClass.description: This object specifies the defaultDS Quality Class.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityAccuracy.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityAccuracy
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityAccuracy.description: This object specifies the defaultDS Quality Accuracy.

ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityOffset.name: ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityOffset
ptpbaseClockDefaultDSQualityOffset.description: This object specifies the defaultDS Quality offset.

ptpbaseClockRunningTable.name: ptpbaseClockRunningTable
ptpbaseClockRunningTable.description: Table of information about the PTP clock running datasets for all domains.

ptpbaseClockRunningEntry.name: ptpbaseClockRunningEntry
ptpbaseClockRunningEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single PTP clock running dataset for a domain.

ptpbaseClockRunningDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockRunningDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockRunningDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockRunningClockTypeIndex.name: ptpbaseClockRunningClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseClockRunningClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseClockRunningInstanceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockRunningInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockRunningInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockRunningState.name: ptpbaseClockRunningState
ptpbaseClockRunningState.description: This object specifies the clock state returned by a PTP engine.

ptpbaseClockRunningPacketsSent.name: ptpbaseClockRunningPacketsSent
ptpbaseClockRunningPacketsSent.description: This object specifies the total number of all unicast and multicast packets that have been sent out for this clock in this domain for this type. These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseClockRunningPacketsReceived.name: ptpbaseClockRunningPacketsReceived
ptpbaseClockRunningPacketsReceived.description: This object specifies the total number of all unicast and multicast packets that have been received for this clock in this domain for this type. These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSTable.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSTable
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSTable.description: Table of information about the PTP clock timePropertiesDS for all domains.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSEntry.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSEntry
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSEntry.reference: Section 8.2.4 ('timePropertiesDS data set member specifications') of [IEEE-1588-2008]
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single PTP clock timePropertiesDS for a domain.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSClockTypeInd.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSClockTypeInd.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSInstanceInde.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSInstanceInde.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSCurrentUTCOf.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSCurrentUTCOffsetValid
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSCurrentUTCOf.description: This object specifies the timePropertiesDS value of whether the current UTC offset is valid.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSCurrentUTCOf.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSCurrentUTCOffset
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSCurrentUTCOf.description: This object specifies the timePropertiesDS value of the current UTC offset. In PTP systems whose epoch is the PTP epoch, the value of timePropertiesDS.currentUtcOffset is the offset between TAI and UTC; otherwise, the value has no meaning. The value shall be in units of seconds.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSLeap59.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSLeap59
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSLeap59.description: This object specifies the Leap59 value in the clock currentDS.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSLeap61.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSLeap61
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSLeap61.description: This object specifies the Leap61 value in the clock currentDS.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSTimeTraceabl.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSTimeTraceable
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSTimeTraceabl.description: This object specifies the Time Traceable value in the clock currentDS.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSFreqTraceabl.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSFreqTraceable
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSFreqTraceabl.description: This object specifies the Frequency Traceable value in the clock currentDS.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSPTPTimescale.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSPTPTimescale
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSPTPTimescale.description: This object specifies the PTP Timescale value in the clock currentDS.

ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSSource.name: ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSSource
ptpbaseClockTimePropertiesDSSource.description: This object specifies the Timesource value in the clock currentDS.

ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSTable.name: ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSTable
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSTable.description: Table of information about the PTP transparentClockDefaultDS for all domains.

ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSEntry.name: ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSEntry
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSEntry.reference: Section 8.3.2 ('transparentClockDefaultDS data set member specifications') of [IEEE-1588-2008]
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single PTP transparent clock defaultDS for a domain.

ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSInstanceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSClockIdentity.name: ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSClockIdentity
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSClockIdentity.description: This object specifies the value of the clockIdentity attribute of the local clock.

ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSNumOfPorts.name: ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSNumOfPorts
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSNumOfPorts.description: This object specifies the number of PTP ports of the device. These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSDelay.name: ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSDelay
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSDelay.description: This object, if the transparent clock is an end-to-end transparent clock, has the value of e2e; if the transparent clock is a peer-to-peer transparent clock, the value is p2p.

ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSPrimaryDomain.name: ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSPrimaryDomain
ptpbaseClockTransDefaultDSPrimaryDomain.description: This object specifies the value of the primary syntonization domain. The initialization value is 0.

ptpbaseClockPortTable.name: ptpbaseClockPortTable
ptpbaseClockPortTable.description: Table of information about the clock ports for a particular domain.

ptpbaseClockPortEntry.name: ptpbaseClockPortEntry
ptpbaseClockPortEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single clock port.

ptpbaseClockPortDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockPortDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockPortClockTypeIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseClockPortClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseClockPortClockInstanceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortClockInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockPortClockInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockPortTablePortNumberIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortTablePortNumberIndex
ptpbaseClockPortTablePortNumberIndex.description: This object specifies the PTP portNumber for this port.

ptpbaseClockPortName.name: ptpbaseClockPortName
ptpbaseClockPortName.description: This object specifies the PTP clock port name configured on the node.

ptpbaseClockPortRole.name: ptpbaseClockPortRole
ptpbaseClockPortRole.description: This object describes the current role (slave/master) of the port.

ptpbaseClockPortSyncTwoStep.name: ptpbaseClockPortSyncTwoStep
ptpbaseClockPortSyncTwoStep.description: This object specifies that two-step clock operation between the PTP master and slave device is enabled.

ptpbaseClockPortCurrentPeerAddressType.name: ptpbaseClockPortCurrentPeerAddressType
ptpbaseClockPortCurrentPeerAddressType.description: This object specifies the current peer's network address type used for PTP communication.

ptpbaseClockPortCurrentPeerAddress.name: ptpbaseClockPortCurrentPeerAddress
ptpbaseClockPortCurrentPeerAddress.description: This object specifies the current peer's network address used for PTP communication.

ptpbaseClockPortNumOfAssociatedPorts.name: ptpbaseClockPortNumOfAssociatedPorts
ptpbaseClockPortNumOfAssociatedPorts.description: This object specifies the following: For a master port - the number of PTP slave sessions (peers) associated with this PTP port. For a slave port - the number of masters available to this slave port (might or might not be peered).

ptpbaseClockPortDSTable.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSTable
ptpbaseClockPortDSTable.description: Table of information about the clock's portDS for a particular domain.

ptpbaseClockPortDSEntry.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSEntry
ptpbaseClockPortDSEntry.description: A table entry that contains portDS information for a single clock port.

ptpbaseClockPortDSDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockPortDSDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockPortDSClockTypeIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseClockPortDSClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseClockPortDSClockInstanceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSClockInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockPortDSClockInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockPortDSPortNumberIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSPortNumberIndex
ptpbaseClockPortDSPortNumberIndex.description: This object specifies the PTP portNumber associated with this PTP port.

ptpbaseClockPortDSName.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSName
ptpbaseClockPortDSName.description: This object specifies the PTP clock portDS name.

ptpbaseClockPortDSPortIdentity.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSPortIdentity
ptpbaseClockPortDSPortIdentity.description: This object specifies the PTP clock port Identity.

ptpbaseClockPortDSlogAnnouncementInterva.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSlogAnnouncementInterval
ptpbaseClockPortDSlogAnnouncementInterva.description: This object specifies the Announce message transmission interval associated with this clock port.

ptpbaseClockPortDSAnnounceRctTimeout.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSAnnounceRctTimeout
ptpbaseClockPortDSAnnounceRctTimeout.description: This object specifies the Announce receipt timeout associated with this clock port.

ptpbaseClockPortDSlogSyncInterval.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSlogSyncInterval
ptpbaseClockPortDSlogSyncInterval.description: This object specifies the Sync message transmission interval.

ptpbaseClockPortDSMinDelayReqInterval.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSMinDelayReqInterval
ptpbaseClockPortDSMinDelayReqInterval.description: This object specifies the Delay_Req message transmission interval.

ptpbaseClockPortDSPeerDelayReqInterval.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSPeerDelayReqInterval
ptpbaseClockPortDSPeerDelayReqInterval.description: This object specifies the Pdelay_Req message transmission interval.

ptpbaseClockPortDSDelayMech.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSDelayMech
ptpbaseClockPortDSDelayMech.description: This object specifies the delay mechanism used. If the clock is an end-to-end clock, the value is e2e; if the clock is a peer to-peer clock, the value is p2p.

ptpbaseClockPortDSPeerMeanPathDelay.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSPeerMeanPathDelay
ptpbaseClockPortDSPeerMeanPathDelay.description: This object specifies the peer meanPathDelay.

ptpbaseClockPortDSGrantDuration.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSGrantDuration
ptpbaseClockPortDSGrantDuration.description: This object specifies the grant duration allocated by the master.

ptpbaseClockPortDSPTPVersion.name: ptpbaseClockPortDSPTPVersion
ptpbaseClockPortDSPTPVersion.description: This object specifies the PTP version being used.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningTable.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningTable
ptpbaseClockPortRunningTable.description: Table of information about the clock ports running datasets for a particular domain.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningEntry.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningEntry
ptpbaseClockPortRunningEntry.description: A table entry that contains running dataset information about a single clock port.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockPortRunningDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningClockTypeIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningClockTypeIndex
ptpbaseClockPortRunningClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the clock type as defined in the textual convention description.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningClockInstanceInde.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningClockInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockPortRunningClockInstanceInde.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningPortNumberIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningPortNumberIndex
ptpbaseClockPortRunningPortNumberIndex.description: This object specifies the PTP portNumber associated with this clock port.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningName.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningName
ptpbaseClockPortRunningName.description: This object specifies the PTP clock port name.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningState.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningState
ptpbaseClockPortRunningState.description: This object specifies the port state returned by PTP engine: initializing faulty disabled listening preMaster master passive uncalibrated slave

ptpbaseClockPortRunningRole.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningRole
ptpbaseClockPortRunningRole.description: This object specifies the Clock Role.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningInterfaceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningInterfaceIndex
ptpbaseClockPortRunningInterfaceIndex.description: This object specifies the interface on the node being used by the PTP clock for PTP communication.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningTransport.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningTransport
ptpbaseClockPortRunningTransport.description: This object specifies the transport protocol being used for PTP communication (the mapping used).

ptpbaseClockPortRunningEncapsulationType.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningEncapsulationType
ptpbaseClockPortRunningEncapsulationType.description: This object specifies the type of encapsulation if the interface is adding extra layers (e.g., VLAN or Pseudowire encapsulation) for the PTP messages.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningTxMode.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningTxMode
ptpbaseClockPortRunningTxMode.description: This object specifies the clock transmission mode as: unicast: Using unicast communication channel multicast: Using multicast communication channel multicast-mix: Using multicast-unicast communication channel

ptpbaseClockPortRunningRxMode.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningRxMode
ptpbaseClockPortRunningRxMode.description: This object specifies the clock receive mode as: unicast: Using unicast communication channel multicast: Using multicast communication channel multicast-mix: Using multicast-unicast communication channel

ptpbaseClockPortRunningPacketsReceived.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningPacketsReceived
ptpbaseClockPortRunningPacketsReceived.description: This object specifies the packets received on the clock port (cumulative). These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseClockPortRunningPacketsSent.name: ptpbaseClockPortRunningPacketsSent
ptpbaseClockPortRunningPacketsSent.description: This object specifies the packets sent on the clock port (cumulative). These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSTable.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSTable
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSTable.description: Table of information about the transparentClockPortDS for a particular domain.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSEntry.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSEntry
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSEntry.description: A table entry that contains clock port transparent dataset information about a single clock port.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSDomainIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSDomainIndex
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the domain number used to create a logical group of PTP devices.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSInstanceIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSInstanceIndex
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPortNumberIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPortNumberIndex
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPortNumberIndex.description: This object specifies the PTP portNumber associated with this port.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPortIdentity.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPortIdentity
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPortIdentity.description: This object specifies the value of the PortIdentity attribute of the local port.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSlogMinPdelayReqIn.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSlogMinPdelayReqInt
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSlogMinPdelayReqIn.description: This object specifies the value of the logarithm to the base 2 of the minPdelayReqInterval.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSFaultyFlag.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSFaultyFlag
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSFaultyFlag.description: This object specifies the value TRUE if the port is faulty and FALSE if the port is operating normally.

ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPeerMeanPathDelay.name: ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPeerMeanPathDelay
ptpbaseClockPortTransDSPeerMeanPathDelay.description: This object specifies, if the delayMechanism used is p2p, the value of the estimate of the current one-way propagation delay, i.e., <meanPathDelay> on the link attached to this port, computed using the peer delay mechanism. If the value of the delayMechanism used is e2e, then the value will be zero.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociateTable.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociateTable
ptpbaseClockPortAssociateTable.description: Table of information about a given port's associated ports. For a master port: multiple slave ports that have established sessions with the current master port. For a slave port: the list of masters available for a given slave port. Session information (packets, errors) to be displayed based on availability and scenario.

ptpbaseEncapsulationTypePWUDPIPLSP.name: ptpbaseEncapsulationTypePWUDPIPLSP
ptpbaseEncapsulationTypePWUDPIPLSP.description: UDP/IP Pseudowire over MPLS Encapsulation type.

ptpbaseEncapsulationTypePWEthernetLSP.name: ptpbaseEncapsulationTypePWEthernetLSP
ptpbaseEncapsulationTypePWEthernetLSP.description: Ethernet Pseudowire over MPLS Encapsulation type.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociateEntry.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociateEntry
ptpbaseClockPortAssociateEntry.description: A table entry that contains information about a single associated port for the given clock port.

ptpClockPortCurrentDomainIndex.name: ptpClockPortCurrentDomainIndex
ptpClockPortCurrentDomainIndex.description: This object specifies the given port's domain number.

ptpClockPortCurrentClockTypeIndex.name: ptpClockPortCurrentClockTypeIndex
ptpClockPortCurrentClockTypeIndex.description: This object specifies the given port's clock type.

ptpClockPortCurrentClockInstanceIndex.name: ptpClockPortCurrentClockInstanceIndex
ptpClockPortCurrentClockInstanceIndex.description: This object specifies the instance of the clock for this clock type in the given domain.

ptpClockPortCurrentPortNumberIndex.name: ptpClockPortCurrentPortNumberIndex
ptpClockPortCurrentPortNumberIndex.description: This object specifies the PTP portNumber for the given port.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePortIndex.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePortIndex
ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePortIndex.description: This object specifies the associated port's serial number in the current port's context.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociateAddressType.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociateAddressType
ptpbaseClockPortAssociateAddressType.description: This object specifies the peer port's network address type used for PTP communication. The OCTET STRING representation of the OID of ptpbaseWellKnownTransportTypes will be used in the values contained in the OCTET STRING.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociateAddress.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociateAddress
ptpbaseClockPortAssociateAddress.description: This object specifies the peer port's network address used for PTP communication.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePacketsSent.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePacketsSent
ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePacketsSent.description: The number of packets sent to this peer port from the current port. These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePacketsReceived.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePacketsReceived
ptpbaseClockPortAssociatePacketsReceived.description: The number of packets received from this peer port by the current port. These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociateInErrors.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociateInErrors
ptpbaseClockPortAssociateInErrors.description: This object specifies the input errors associated with the peer port. These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseClockPortAssociateOutErrors.name: ptpbaseClockPortAssociateOutErrors
ptpbaseClockPortAssociateOutErrors.description: This object specifies the output errors associated with the peer port. These counters are discontinuous.

ptpbaseMIBCompliancesSystemInfo.name: ptpbaseMIBCompliancesSystemInfo
ptpbaseMIBCompliancesSystemInfo.description: Compliance statement for agents that provide read-only support for PTPBASE-MIB to provide system-level information of clock devices. Such devices can only be monitored using this MIB module. The module is implemented with support for read-only. In other words, only monitoring is available by implementing this MODULE-COMPLIANCE.

ptpbaseMIBCompliancesClockInfo.name: ptpbaseMIBCompliancesClockInfo
ptpbaseMIBCompliancesClockInfo.description: Compliance statement for agents that provide read-only support for PTPBASE-MIB to provide clock-related information. Such devices can only be monitored using this MIB module. The module is implemented with support for read-only. In other words, only monitoring is available by implementing this MODULE-COMPLIANCE.

ptpbaseMIBCompliancesClockPortInfo.name: ptpbaseMIBCompliancesClockPortInfo
ptpbaseMIBCompliancesClockPortInfo.description: Compliance statement for agents that provide read-only support for PTPBASE-MIB to provide clock-port-related information. Such devices can only be monitored using this MIB module. The module is implemented with support for read-only. In other words, only monitoring is available by implementing this MODULE-COMPLIANCE.

ptpbaseMIBCompliancesTransparentClockInf.name: ptpbaseMIBCompliancesTransparentClockInfo
ptpbaseMIBCompliancesTransparentClockInf.description: Compliance statement for agents that provide read-only support for PTPBASE-MIB to provide transparent-clock-related information. Such devices can only be monitored using this MIB module. The module is implemented with support for read-only. In other words, only monitoring is available by implementing this MODULE-COMPLIANCE.

ptpbaseMIBSystemInfoGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBSystemInfoGroup
ptpbaseMIBSystemInfoGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing system-wide information

ptpbaseMIBClockCurrentDSGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockCurrentDSGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockCurrentDSGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP currentDS information

ptpbaseMIBClockParentDSGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockParentDSGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockParentDSGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP parentDS information

ptpbaseMIBClockDefaultDSGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockDefaultDSGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockDefaultDSGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP defaultDS information

ptpbaseMIBClockRunningGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockRunningGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockRunningGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP running state information

ptpbaseMIBClockTimepropertiesGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockTimepropertiesGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockTimepropertiesGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP Time Properties information

ptpbaseMIBClockTranparentDSGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockTranparentDSGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockTranparentDSGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP transparentClockDefaultDS information

ptpbaseMIBClockPortGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockPortGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockPortGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing information for a given PTP Port

ptpbaseMIBClockPortDSGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockPortDSGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockPortDSGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP portDS information

ptpbaseMIBClockPortRunningGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockPortRunningGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockPortRunningGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP running interface information

ptpbaseMIBClockPortTransDSGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockPortTransDSGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockPortTransDSGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing PTP transparentClockPortDS information

ptpbaseMIBClockPortAssociateGroup.name: ptpbaseMIBClockPortAssociateGroup
ptpbaseMIBClockPortAssociateGroup.description: Group that aggregates objects describing information on peer PTP ports for a given PTP clock port
